CDISC Notes:
Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or
submissions involving the product.
Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

Sponsor-defined reference number. Perhaps pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor’s operational database. Example: Line
number on a CRF page.

Verbatim name of the protocol deviation criterion. Example: IVRS PROCESS DEVIATION - NO DOSE CALL PERFORMED. The DVTERM values will map to
the controlled terminology in DVDECOD, such as TREATMENT DEVIATION.
Controlled terminology for the name of the protocol deviation. Examples: SUBJECT NOT WITHDRAWN AS PER PROTOCOL, SELECTION CRITERIA NOT MET, EXCLUDED CONCOMITANT MEDICATION, TREATMENT DEVIATION.
Category of the protocol deviation criterion.
A further categorization of the protocol deviation.
Epoch associated with the start date/time of the deviation. Examples: TREATMENT PHASE, SCREENING, and FOLLOW-UP.
Start date/time of deviation represented in ISO 8601 character format.
End date/time of deviation represented in ISO 8601 character format.
